column4: Hey, I'm trying to format an original xbox hard drive.  The disk utility that comes with linux is getting an error.  What other apps should I try?
It's just called 'Disk Utility', its the default one with 11.04
Exactly what are you trying to do?  What type of file system are you wanting to put on it?
Which drive is it?  sudo fdisk -l
Er, before I do that, how the f do I turn off the new GUI?  I'm running off a usb drive now and I don't have the option to log off and select a new one there
I have no idea how to bring up terminal w/ the new gui
Well it would be:   sudo  mkfs.ext4 /dev/s??#
sudo fdisk -l does not show the harddrive
But the harddrive is there in disk utility
sudo fdisk -l only shows the USB drive
martian_: If you don't see it in the output of  sudo fdisk -l   you will not be able to format it.
If you don't see it in the output of  sudo fdisk -l   you will not be able to format it.
